item.title: 香港家族办公室与顶级中国基金合作，瞄准富人群体
item.description: 在房地产不景气的背景下，香港最大的地产代理公司之一正通过与中国排名第二的共同基金合作来推动财富管理产品，从而加强其家族办公室业务。【原文：One of Hong Kong’s biggest property agencies is ramping up its family office business by partnering with China’s No. 2 mutual fund to push wealth management products amid a real estate slump.】

item.title: 中东风险消退，石油连跌两日后企稳
item.description: 由于有迹象表明中东风险有所缓解，石油在连续两天下跌后企稳，市场将注意力转移到全球供应平衡和欧佩克+的产量前景上。【原文：Oil steadied after a two-day decline on signs of easing Middle East risks, with the market shifting attention to global supply balances and OPEC+’s production outlook.】

item.title: 美国大选的紧张情绪助长了对亚洲主权债券的押注
item.description: 投资者纷纷转向亚洲主权债券，以渡过美国大选的难关，这给今年已经受益于数十亿美元外资流入的市场带来了提振。【原文：Investors are turning to Asian sovereign bonds to ride out the US election, giving a boost to markets that have already benefited from billions of dollars of foreign inflows this year.】

item.title: 在可能创纪录的季度到来之前，卖空者撤出比亚迪
item.description: 由于中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪的季度营收将首次超过特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.【原文：Short sellers are backing off from BYD Co. shares, with the Chinese electric vehicle maker tipped to report higher quarterly revenue than Tesla Inc. for the first time ever.】

item.title: 微软称俄罗斯黑客正瞄准美国官员
item.description: 据微软公司（Microsoft Corp）称，俄罗斯黑客正在针对美国政府官员、国防工作者和其他人发起新的电子邮件钓鱼活动，目标是数千人。【原文：Russian hackers are going after US government officials, defense workers and others in a new email phishing campaign targeting thousands of people, according to Microsoft Corp.】

item.title: 亚洲科技股涨跌不一，开盘后走势低迷：市场综述
item.description: 在华尔街科技公司业绩喜忧参半之后，亚洲多数股市开盘谨慎，交易商也在为下周的美国大选和美联储利率决议做准备。【原文：Most stocks in Asia are set for a cautious open following mixed results from Wall Street tech companies and as traders prepare for next week’s US election and Federal Reserve rate decision.】

item.title: OpenAI 与 Broadcom 合作开发专注于推理的人工智能芯片
item.description: 据两位熟悉内情的人士透露，OpenAI 正在与博通公司（Broadcom Inc.【原文：OpenAI is working with Broadcom Inc. to develop a new artificial intelligence chip specifically focused on running AI models after they’ve been trained, according to two people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国数据和大选引发需求，黄金再创新高
item.description: 周三亚市早盘，黄金创下历史新高，交易员们在消化最新的美国经济数据，并权衡即将到来的总统大选可能对市场造成的干扰。【原文：Gold reached a record high in early Asian trading on Wednesday, as traders digested the latest US economic data and weighed potential market disruption ahead of the looming presidential election.】

item.title: 监管机构称加拿大夫妇在私人贷款机构 Bridging 实施诈骗
item.description: 加拿大最高证券监管机构裁定，经营多伦多私人贷款公司 Bridging Finance Inc. 的夫妻团队涉嫌欺诈、收受回扣并试图误导调查人员。【原文：The husband-and-wife team who ran Toronto private lender Bridging Finance Inc. committed fraud, took kickbacks and tried to mislead investigators about it, Canada’s top securities regulator has ruled.】

item.title: Arctos 正在洽谈收购美国橄榄球联盟水牛城比尔队的少数股权
item.description: 据知情人士透露，投资公司 Arctos Partners 正在洽谈收购美国国家橄榄球联盟水牛城比尔队的少数股份。【原文：Investment firm Arctos Partners is in talks to acquire a minority stake in the National Football League’s Buffalo Bills, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 三星 1220 亿美元的突然破产显示了沉睡于人工智能的代价
item.description: 就在几个月前，三星电子公司看起来还准备从全球人工智能热潮中获益：利润激增，股价飙升至历史新高。【原文：Just a few months ago, Samsung Electronics Co. looked primed to benefit from the global AI boom: profits were surging and its stock was rising toward an all-time high.】

item.title: 日本第二大养老基金致力于将另类资产翻番
item.description: 日本第二大养老基金的目标是将其持有的房地产和私募股权等另类资产增加一倍，以提高回报率。【原文：Japan’s second-biggest pension fund aims to double its holdings of alternative assets such as real estate and private equity to boost returns.】

item.title: 政治博彩能否左右美国大选？
item.description:
预测市场已经存在了数百年，但其改变现实的能力正在不断增强。【原文：

Prediction markets have been around for hundreds of years, but their ability to change reality is increasing.

】

item.title: 大卫-埃里森将控制家族在派拉蒙的股份
item.description: 独立制片人大卫-埃里森（David Ellison）将控制其家族在派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）的股份，一旦他的 Skydance Media 完成与这家大型电影电视公司的合并。【原文：Independent filmmaker David Ellison will control his family’s stake in Paramount Global once his Skydance Media completes its merger with the larger movie and TV company.】

item.title: 高盛称交易员过于担心美国投票结果延迟
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. said global investors are overstating the risk that financial markets will be plunged into uncertainty by the lack of a clear victor soon after next week’s US presidential election.】

item.title: 美国遏制习近平科技霸权的努力正在失败
item.description:
美国以外的世界越来越多地驾驶中国的电动汽车，使用中国的智能手机浏览网页，用中国的太阳能电池板为家庭供电。【原文：

The world outside the US is increasingly driving Chinese electric vehicles, scrolling the web on Chinese smartphones and powering their homes with Chinese solar panels.

】

item.title: 支付业务量强劲，Visa 利润攀升，超出预期
item.description: 全球最大的支付网络维萨公司（Visa Inc.【原文：Visa Inc., the world’s biggest payments network, posted a fiscal fourth-quarter profit that beat Wall Street expectations as cross-border transactions increased.】

item.title: 芝加哥商品交易所（CME）获得期货委员会商户批准，引发反弹
item.description: 芝加哥商品交易所集团公司（CME Group Inc.【原文：CME Group Inc. won approval to operate its own futures commission merchant, a move that received swift criticism from some market participants.】

item.title: 债券交易员对冲更深跌势，目标美国 10 年期债券收益率为 4.5%
item.description: 国债期权看跌的基调正在形成，因为交易员们押注，未来几天美国总统大选的关键阶段将加深债券的损失，并引发波动性的加剧。【原文：A bearish tone is taking hold in Treasury options as traders bet that a crucial stretch ahead — with the US presidential election just days away — will deepen losses in bonds and spark bouts of increased volatility.】

item.title: 经济疲软，新西兰星火公司下调盈利预期
item.description: 由于经济疲软抑制了对移动和信息技术服务的需求，新西兰 Spark 公司下调了盈利指导，并表示计划出售资产。【原文：Spark New Zealand lowered earnings guidance and said it plans to sell assets as a weak economy curbs demand for mobile and information technology services.】

item.title: 法官延长波多黎各公用事业破产诉讼中止期
item.description: 监督波多黎各电力公司破产案的法官延长了与该案有关的诉讼的暂停期，因为电力供应商正在与债券持有人就如何减少其债务进行谈判。【原文：The judge overseeing the bankruptcy of Puerto Rico’s electric utility extended a halt on litigation related to the case as the power provider negotiates with bondholders on how to reduce its debts.】

item.title: AMD 预测落空，表明人工智能发展步伐放缓
item.description: 先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices Inc.【原文：Advanced Micro Devices Inc. gave a lackluster revenue forecast for the current period, sparking concern that its artificial intelligence sales are growing more slowly than anticipated.】

item.title: 预测假日广告销售放缓后 Snap 下跌
item.description: Snap Inc. 在预计假日季度销售额低于分析师预期后出现下滑，这表明这家视频和信息公司尽管对广告业务进行了全面改革，但仍在努力与 Meta Platforms Inc. 和 Alphabet Inc.【原文：Snap Inc. declined after projecting sales for the holiday quarter that fell short of analysts’ estimates, a sign the video and messaging company is still struggling to compete with larger peers like Meta Platforms Inc. and Alphabet Inc.’s Google despite an overhaul of its advertising business.】

item.title: Alphabet 因谷歌云增长而销售额超出预期
item.description: 谷歌母公司 Alphabet Inc. 公布的第三季度销售额增幅超过分析师预期，主要得益于其云计算业务的增长。【原文：Google parent Alphabet Inc. reported third-quarter sales that climbed more than analysts expected, helped by the growth of its cloud computing business.】

item.title: Reddit 发出假日季强劲信号，股价飙升
item.description: Reddit Inc. 第三季度销售额超过预期，并预计假日旺季将强劲增长，股价因此大涨超过 16%，创下历史新高，因为这家新近上市的公司在广告技术方面的投资持续见效。【原文：Reddit Inc. shares surged more than 16% after beating sales expectations for the third quarter and projecting a strong holiday season, pushing the stock to an all-time high as the newly public company continues to see its investments in advertising technology pay off.】

item.title: 官员指控印度最高部长授权在加拿大犯罪
item.description: 一位加拿大政府高级官员说，印度内政部长阿米特-沙阿批准了在加拿大各地发生的包括勒索和杀人在内的暴力浪潮。【原文：Indian Home Affairs Minister Amit Shah authorized a wave of violence across Canada that included extortion and homicides, said a senior Canadian government official.】

item.title: 资产支持债务销售额突破 3130 亿美元，刷新金融危机后纪录
item.description: 从汽车贷款到飞机租赁，再到地铁特许经营费，随着银行努力满足新的资本规定，以及保险公司对高收益债务的追捧，以各种形式支持的债务销售创下了金融危机以来的最高水平。【原文：Sales of debt backed by everything from auto loans to airplane leases to Subway franchise fees have hit their highest level since the financial crisis, as banks try to meet new capital rules and insurance companies clamor for higher-yielding debt.】

item.title: 菲利普斯 66 预计将超过其 30 亿美元的资产出售目标
item.description: 美国市值最大的燃料制造商菲利普斯 66 周二告诉投资者，该公司预计资产销售额将超过 30 亿美元的目标，并计划出售更多资产。【原文：Phillips 66, the biggest US fuelmaker by market value, told investors Tuesday it expects to surpass its $3 billion target for asset sales with more dispositions planned.】

item.title: 耶伦称欺诈是银行系统日益严重的巨大问题
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）表示，银行系统中的欺诈行为正在成为一个巨大的问题，美国财政部目前正在利用人工智能来检测和处理这一问题。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said that fraud in the banking system is becoming a huge problem and that her department is now using artificial intellignece to detect and deal with the issue.】

item.title: 巴西雷亚尔因削减开支规模的不确定性而走低
item.description: 巴西财政部长费尔南多-哈达德（Fernando Haddad）拒绝证实政府正在考虑削减开支的数额，称他不知道当地报纸报道的数字从何而来，巴西雷亚尔因此扩大了跌幅。【原文：Brazil’s real extended losses after Finance Minister Fernando Haddad refused to confirm the amount of spending cuts the government is considering, saying he didn’t know where numbers reported by local newspapers had come from.】
